intro: Hieracium theiodes, commonly known as the small mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, forming clusters that attract pollinators like bees and flies. Hieracium theiodes is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it has a creeping growth habit with rhizomes that allow it to spread vegetatively.
